speaker: Jasmine
text: I’ve been reading the reviews, and most users are really excited about the new scheduling interface.
ipa: aɪv bɪn ˈriːdɪŋ ðə rɪˈvjuːz, ənd moʊst ˈjuːzərz ɑːr ˈrɪəli ɪkˈsaɪtɪd əˈbaʊt ðə nu ˈʃɛdjuːlɪŋ ˈɪntərfeɪs.
stress: I’VE BEEN READING the REVIEWS, and MOST USERS are REALLY EXCITED about the NEW SCHEDULING INTERFACE.
linking:
"been reading" → /bɪn ˈriːdɪŋ/ (n + r linking)
"about the" → /əˈbaʊt ðə/ (t + th linking)

speaker: Leo
text: Yeah, but I also noticed a few people complained about performance issues in older devices.
ipa: jæ, bət aɪ ˈɔːlsoʊ ˈnoʊtɪst ə fjuː ˈpiːpəl kəmˈpleɪnd əˈbaʊt pərˈfɔːrməns ˈɪʃuːz ɪn ˈoʊldər dɪˈvaɪsɪz.
stress: YEAH, but I ALSO NOTICED a FEW PEOPLE COMPLAINED about PERFORMANCE ISSUES in OLDER DEVICES.
linking:
"noticed a" → /ˈnoʊtɪst ə/ (d + a linking)
"about performance" → /əˈbaʊt pərˈfɔːrməns/ (t + p linking)

speaker: Jasmine
text: True. We might need to talk to the mobile devs and see if there’s a workaround. Also, some feedback referred to the UI being a bit too cluttered.
ipa: truː. wi maɪt niːd tə tɔːk tə ðə ˈmoʊbəl dɛvz ənd si ɪf ðɛrz ə ˈwɜːrkəˌraʊnd. ˈɔːlsoʊ, səm ˈfiːdbæk rɪˈfɜːrd tə ðə ˌjuːˈaɪ ˈbiːɪŋ ə bɪt tuː ˈklʌtərd.
stress: TRUE. We MIGHT NEED to TALK to the MOBILE DEVS and SEE if there’s a WORKAROUND. ALSO, some FEEDBACK REFERRED to the UI being a BIT TOO CLUTTERED.
linking:
"talk to" → /tɔːk tə/ (k + t linking)
"referred to" → /rɪˈfɜːrd tə/ (d + t linking)

speaker: Leo
text: I spoke to Diego from UX earlier — he’s already thinking about simplifying the layout for smaller screens.
ipa: aɪ spoʊk tə diˈeɪɡoʊ frəm juː ɛks ˈɜːrliər — hiz ɔːlˈrɛdi ˈθɪŋkɪŋ əˈbaʊt ˈsɪmplɪˌfaɪɪŋ ðə ˈleɪaʊt fər ˈsmɔːlər skriːnz.
stress: I SPOKE to DIEGO from UX EARLIER — he’s ALREADY THINKING about SIMPLIFYING the LAYOUT for SMALLER SCREENS.
linking:
"spoke to" → /spoʊk tə/ (k + t linking)
"thinking about" → /ˈθɪŋkɪŋ əˈbaʊt/ (g + a linking)

speaker: Jasmine
text: That’s great. And did anyone apologize for the delay in the release notes? Some customers wrote to us about that.
ipa: ðæts ɡreɪt. ənd dɪd ˈɛniwʌn əˈpɑːlədʒaɪz fər ðə dɪˈleɪ ɪn ðə rɪˈliːs noʊts? səm ˈkʌstəmərz roʊt tu ʌs əˈbaʊt ðæt.
stress: THAT’S GREAT. And DID ANYONE APOLOGIZE for the DELAY in the RELEASE NOTES? Some CUSTOMERS WROTE to us about THAT.
linking:
"did anyone" → /dɪd ˈɛniwʌn/ (d + a linking)
"wrote to" → /roʊt tu/ (t + t linking)

speaker: Leo
text: Yeah, Carlos explained to them that we were waiting for QA clearance. But we probably need a better process for communicating changes.
ipa: jæ, ˈkɑːrloʊs ɪkˈspleɪnd tə ðɛm ðæt wi wər ˈweɪtɪŋ fər ˌkjuːˈeɪ ˈklɪrəns. bət wi ˈprɑːbəbli niːd ə ˈbɛtər ˈprɑːsɛs fər kəˈmjuːnɪkeɪtɪŋ ˈʧeɪndʒɪz.
stress: YEAH, CARLOS EXPLAINED to them that WE were WAITING for QA CLEARANCE. But we PROBABLY NEED a BETTER PROCESS for COMMUNICATING CHANGES.
linking:
"explained to" → /ɪkˈspleɪnd tə/ (d + t linking)
"waiting for" → /ˈweɪtɪŋ fər/ (g + f linking)

speaker: Jasmine
text: Definitely. And I’m concerned about our Slack channel being too quiet. I relied on it a lot for instant team feedback.
ipa: ˈdɛfɪnətli. ənd aɪm kənˈsɜːrnd əˈbaʊt aʊər slæk ˈʧænəl ˈbiːɪŋ tuː ˈkwaɪət. aɪ rɪˈlaɪd ɒn ɪt ə lɒt fər ˈɪnstənt tiːm ˈfiːdbæk.
stress: DEFINITELY. And I’m CONCERNED about our SLACK CHANNEL being TOO QUIET. I RELIED on it a LOT for INSTANT TEAM FEEDBACK.
linking:
"concerned about" → /kənˈsɜːrnd əˈbaʊt/ (d + a linking)
"relied on" → /rɪˈlaɪd ɒn/ (d + o linking)

speaker: Leo
text: Same here. I think people are focused on wrapping up their sprints. Maybe we should remind them about posting updates.
ipa: seɪm hɪər. aɪ θɪŋk ˈpiːpəl ɑːr ˈfoʊkəst ɒn ˈræpɪŋ ʌp ðɛər sprɪnts. ˈmeɪbi wi ʃəd rɪˈmaɪnd ðɛm əˈbaʊt ˈpoʊstɪŋ ˈʌpdeɪts.
stress: SAME HERE. I THINK PEOPLE are FOCUSED on WRAPPING UP their SPRINTS. MAYBE we should REMIND them about POSTING UPDATES.
linking:
"focused on" → /ˈfoʊkəst ɒn/ (t + o linking)
"remind them" → /rɪˈmaɪnd ðɛm/ (d + th linking)

speaker: Jasmine
text: Good idea. Also, let’s not forget about the accessibility audit. I’m anxious about the results coming in next week.
ipa: ɡʊd aɪˈdɪə. ˈɔːlsoʊ, lɛts nɒt fəˈɡɛt əˈbaʊt ði əkˌsɛsəˈbɪləti ˈɔːdɪt. aɪm ˈæŋkʃəs əˈbaʊt ðə rɪˈzʌlts ˈkʌmɪŋ ɪn nɛkst wiːk.
stress: GOOD idea. ALSO, let’s NOT FORGET about the ACCESSIBILITY AUDIT. I’m ANXIOUS about the RESULTS coming in NEXT WEEK.
linking:
"not forget" → /nɒt fəˈɡɛt/ (t + f linking)
"about the" → /əˈbaʊt ði/ (t + th linking)
"coming in" → /ˈkʌmɪŋ ɪn/ (g + i linking)

speaker: Leo
text: Fingers crossed. We prepared for that with all those alt text and contrast fixes, so hopefully it goes well.
ipa: ˈfɪŋɡərz krɔːst. wi prɪˈpɛrd fər ðæt wɪð ɔːl ðoʊz ɔːlt tɛkst ənd ˈkɒntræst ˈfɪksɪz, soʊ ˈhoʊpfəli ɪt ɡoʊz wɛl.
stress: FINGERS CROSSED. We PREPARED for that with ALL those ALT TEXT and CONTRAST FIXES, so HOPEFULLY it GOES WELL.
linking:
"prepared for" → /prɪˈpɛrd fər/ (d + f linking)
"goes well" → /ɡoʊz wɛl/ (z + w linking)

speaker: Jasmine
text: Here’s hoping. Thanks for jumping in today — I really appreciate your help.
ipa: hɪərz ˈhoʊpɪŋ. θæŋks fər ˈʤʌmpɪŋ ɪn təˈdeɪ — aɪ ˈrɪəli əˈpriːʃieɪt jʊər hɛlp.
stress: HERE’S HOPING. THANKS for JUMPING in TODAY — I REALLY APPRECIATE your HELP.
linking:
"thanks for" → /θæŋks fər/ (s + f linking)
"jumping in" → /ˈʤʌmpɪŋ ɪn/ (g + i linking)
"appreciate your" → /əˈpriːʃieɪt jʊər/ (t + y linking)
